comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Don't know who the guy with the duck is, but the other fellow, George McAneny, was a prominent New Yorker who held a number of positions in government during his career. From 1914 to 1916, he was president of New York's Board of Aldermen. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_McAneny He is pictured in many Bain photos, sometimes in his temporary role as Acting Mayor of New York. www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=mcaneny

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think this, and some other nearby Bain pictures, was taken at New York's Washington Market, demolished in the 1960's. McAneny championed its renovation as Manhattan Borough President, according to the caption on this LOC photo: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2006686047/ and see: www.shorpy.com/node/1149?size=_original#caption On October 25, 1915, the renovated market was officially opened. McAneny and the Housewives League (founded by Mrs. Julian Heath) are mentioned in this article: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30D13F93C5D1773... The demolition: lcweb2.loc.gov/service/pnp/ppmsca/12700/12747v.jpg In this picture, the facade of the market is to the right. In the other pictures involving poultry or shopping, the building is easier to see.
